headline: Mom's Chicken Pot Pie
description: This chicken pot pie with potatoes uses a prepared double-crust pastry to help achieve this easy, beginner-friendly recipe your family will love.

video.description: This family recipe for chicken pot pie is creamy, cozy, and comforting!
video.name: Mom's Chicken Pot Pie

name: Mom's Chicken Pot Pie
recipeIngredient: 0.5 (15 ounce) can whole new potatoes, drained
1 (15 ounce) package prepared double-crust pie pastry

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion, flour, salt, and pepper in hot butter until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Pour in broth and milk; bring to a boil and cook until slightly thickened, about 1 minute. Remove the skillet from heat and stir in chicken, peas and carrots, and potatoes.

Press 1 pie pastry into the bottom of a 9-inch, deep-dish pie pan. Pour chicken mixture into pie pastry. Top with remaining pastry and press edges together to seal. Cut several slits in top pastry. Place pie on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, about 30 minutes. Let pie cool and filling thicken at room temperature for 15 to 20 minutes before cutting.

review.reviewBody: Love it

(2-Chicken Pot Pies) I made it. I used Carrots only-No peas/Wife is not a fan of peas. I used a can of Cream of Chicken Soup and the Juice of a can of Chicken Noodle soup as well as some Chicken Stock to make the sauce with the Onions, Butter etc. just as the recipe made it (Electric Oven). I baked the pie at 400F for 25 Minutes and 425 for 25 Minutes or so. I basted the top crust lightly with Melted Butter. Other than that I followed the recipe. It turned out awesome We polished off 1 pie just my wife and I We have the other pie left for Wednesday night!
Step-by-step very easy to follow came out great

I researched how to keep the bottom crust from being soggy by creating a barrier between crust and filling. The crust was excellent. My husband was dismayed by the scant portion of chicken in the pie. I loved the pie. But instead of the 5 oz of chicken in the pie, next time I will make certain to have 20 oz or so of chicken. I used chicken thigh & leg meat since I always use chicken thighs & leg meat in any chicken dish because of the increased moisture and richer taste. I have the time to stew the chicken leg quarters with vegetables which yields delicious meat and broth since I am retired.

I teeter between 3.5 and 4 stars. This was the perfect recipe and amount for 1 deep dish pot pie. That said, I wasn‚Äôt wowed. I feel like I should have gone heavier on seasonings and maybe made a homemade crust? I read some reviews where people used a rotisserie chicken; that might be a good touch. I did opt for frozen veggies, used butter and even added a little celery. I will try it again though.

I used rotisserie chicken and a little more onion than called for -- about 1/2 cup. It's a great recipe as is, but I agree that some additional spices could be added to give it some more pizzazz. Next time, I may try adding 1/4 tsp of garlic powder, thyme, and paprika or cayenne.
This is the recipe I use for pot pie, but I make homemade crust. Delicious! I also cut up fresh potatoes and cook them.

First off, my wife does not care for Chicken pot Pie. I absolutely love it. When we go out to dinner at the area sportsman club my wife always orders the chicken pot pie soup. This recipe is very very similar to the chicken pot pie soup my wife loves. I don‚Äôt understand it, but I made this recipe, deleted the carrots as I ran out and substituted fresh mushrooms. I made 2 small pies and the leftover I diluted it with a little bit of 1/2 and 1/2 cream and gave it to my wife in the soup form. She loved it. She said it was a lot better than she normally get as the sportsman club. Im guessing, she just does not like the pastry and the thickness of this pie filling. So when I make it, i also turn it into soup accompanied by garlic bread for my wife! Thank you! It‚Äôs the best!
This is my go-to chicken pot pie recipe! I add garlic to the onions and add some werstishire sauce when cooking the chicken. Such a delicious recipe!
Delicious it tasted just right. The only thing I changed was I used a fresh potato instead of canned

I made it as a pan casserole. Instead of potatoes, I used 1/2 inch cut asparagus that I microwaved for 1 minute. I also cut fresh carrots into half circles and microwaved them for 2 minutes. I added a can of LeSeur Peas. Followed the recipe for the rest and cooked it for about 20 minutes on the stovetop. Served it over egg noodles. Delicious.
I love this recipe. I use it all the time.
Delicious!!! üòã wayyyy better than my moms ‚Äòmade up‚Äô versions haha A classic perfect recipe! TY I used fresh vegetables & just microwaved them for quick cooking.

I used the crust recipe from Natashas kitchen. I used the veggies that I had, (which were more than the recipe stated so I had more filling than fit) and added some dried herbs. It held together well after cutting it once cooled. Delicious.

I added 2 cloves of garlic, 1/2 cup diced celery, used a whole chopped onion and more salt and pepper and 1 tsp thyme. I also used a fresh chopped carrot and a chopped potato. I cooked the carrot and potato together first then added them. I used frozen peas. I used frozen pie crusts. Very tasty and easy. It really needs the thyme though.

I make a roux, omit the milk and use 1/2 white wine and 1/2 stock, fresh carrots, frozen peas, pearl onions, broccoli, rotisserie chicken, poultry seasoning, salt and pepper to taste. Anything in a can adds way too much sodium. Delicious pie!

I've been making this pot pie for ten years now, and it is always great, even when I mess it up a little. I use chicken or turkey, vary the amount and variety of vegetables, with potatoes or without, and it is always loved. I have used 1/2 can of cream of chicken soup with 1 cup of chicken broth and it's excellent, but I've also followed the recipe to a T and it's excellent. I like to increase the gravy, but I don't double it, more like I increase it a half of the original quantity. My husband doesn't like onions in his food, but I love the flavor, so I puree it in this dish, as sort of suggested by a user here. 

Try this, it's wonderful!

Great dinner. I used with frozen vegetables, condensed chicken with herbs, milk to fill up the can and chicken broth instead of water. A little sage, thyme. Made my own pie dough. My son loved it. Will make again. My picture was too big for their requirements.
It was delicious and look forward to making it again.
Can‚Äôt make a mistake with these instructions it comes out perfect every time delicious it‚Äôs even great for seconds
I made it exactly as written and it was superb! Hubby went back for more I may try it again using some of the advice from other reviewers, just to see, but this was good as is.

It was great tasting, the only thing different I did was leave out the peas (their evil) lol instead I use potatoes and I used a pie crust. No thyme so left it out. For the flour I use Wonder Flour, made it silky. I poach my skin on chicken and used the broth.

I made this tonight for dinner. It was delicious!! The only change I made, was instead of using just frozen peas and carrots, I used ‚ÄúSteamed mixed vegetables‚Äù from Aldi‚Äôs. I like having green beans and corn in my pot pie. I had a rotisserie chicken from Sam‚Äôs Club, earlier in the week and used up all of my leftover chicken!! My husband loved it. I‚Äôll be making this again!

I left out the flour and added a can of cream of potato soup. I thought that was too much milk, so had to scoop into crust with a slotted spoon to reduce liquid. Substituted flavored Turkey Broth for chicken stock. Used vegall and forgot about messing with potatoes. Exceptional! Don‚Äôt forget a few pats of butter on top before adding top crust.
Made it just like the recipe. Watched while it was in the oven to make sure is was bubbling. Let we for about 25 minutes. Really good. Would not change a thing about the recipe.
Comfort food on steroids...a new favorite recipe.
so much flavor
Perfect pot pie recipe. My family really enjoyed this recipe. A great winter meal. Will continue to make this recipe!
I seasoned the chicken while cooking it.
DELICIOUS! ??????

Oh my! Just like it‚Äôs described...easy and good. I took the ‚Äúeasy‚Äù a bit further and used canned chicken. Two cans made the 2 cups needed. And I added a can of green beans, kept the potatoes (yum) and added a bit of celery in with the onions. You can‚Äôt go wrong with this recipe. I know some people don‚Äôt like to hear how the recipe was changed, but I find it helpful to know what works and how I can make it work even if I don‚Äôt have all the ingredients. I tossed in some slices of fresh mushrooms just before baking. That worked well too. (And had a bit of the mixture that wouldn‚Äôt fit in the pie so I put it in another dish using bread as my crust. We‚Äôll see how that turns out.)
Loved this recipe I cut peeled and boiled russet potatoes and added a can of cream of chicken soup. It was delicious Husband loved it
Excellent so much better than the store bought kind. I will definitely be making this recipe again.

Easy to make and delicious. 
To prepare chicken: cover with water in a pot, bring to boil, simmer for 12 minutes, remove from pot and cool 10 minutes, shred with 2 forks. If it tastes dry, you probably cooked it too long.
This recipe is PERFECT just as it‚Äôs written!! I didn‚Äôt change a thing and it tasted DELICIOUS!!
Delicious! Better than I expected.
Easy, real easy. I didn't use deep dish pie crusts, makes 2 pies. It allows me to eat a more modest portion.
Delicious! Used cooked potatoes rather than canned.
I added everything with the exception of potatoes. It was delicious! I‚Äôve made it twice in one week!

Gave it a 4, but made it into a fabulous 5 with a few changes...
Baked the bottom crust for 5 minutes before adding the mixture - made it crisp and not soggy
Used a can condensed cream of chicken & mushroom soup, 1 cup of water and 1/2 cup of milk
Added herbs per other suggestions
Cubed one large potato and 3 large carrots which I added to the boiling mixture
Used one small can of peas
Made the guts in the morning, then refrigerated, so 45 minutes in the oven.
Was perfect and will definitely make again!

I made this recipe ‚Äúas is‚Äù and wouldn‚Äôt change a thing. The ingredients were perfect! Note: I lined my skillet with parchment paper to make sure the crust didn‚Äôt stick and it worked out perfectly!??
I love this!! It has a real homemade taste. I use my moms pie crust recipe . Plan to make it again !!
Very good. I used fresh vegetable instead of frozen.

There was a little filling left over and i made my crust from scratch, a simple buttery crust. 
I used boneless chicken thighs for my meat.
This thing was massive and the family gobbled it up with hardly any left over. I did add some chopped celery and a handful of spinach as well and seasoned with garlic and onion powders.

We really liked it a lot. I had cooked potatoes, carrots and a chicken breast left over and I wanted a recipe to use them, and I found this one. I followed directions exactly, using my own chicken broth left from cooking chicken the day before. My husband liked it very much. I did add a teaspoon of chicken base that you add to soup for extra chicken flavor. I'm saving this recipe to make again soon.

I've made this a few times now and it always works out really well. It's a really good, basic recipe. The only things I've changed is using smoked chicken (my husband loves using his smoker!) and fresh celery, carrots and cooked potatoes. I've also added a few strips of bacon to perk it up. I think a bit of garlic would be good too.
OMG! It was the best chicken pot pie I have ever had! I‚Äôm no chef, but it turned out perfect! What a great recipe.
I made it with top crust only. Came out delicious though.
Easy and delicious. I substituted the canned peas and carrots with a small bag of frozen mixed vegetables and added a can of sliced potatoes. Just the right amount. It is delicious!

This is a good recipe to follow. I think it is still important to add your own variation to seasoning, etc. The cook time does not include the time it takes for you to make your chicken to add to the recipe. I used the chicken broth from the baked and it was fire!

I enjoyed this recipe a lot!

I have made many many pot pies in my day. I stumbled on this recipe while horsing around on Allrecipes. I think it might be a bit bland as is, so I added Thyme, Jane's Crazy Salt and a sprinkle of poultry seasoning. I used 2 large chicken breasts that I boiled for 20 minutes with onion, bay leaf, some garlic, salt and pepper. This is wonderful and no need for canned soup!
This is one of my fav recipes of all time. Simply delish!
Followed it to the letter. Turned out great
This is a perfect recipe just the way it is! Loved it
So quick and easy. We used chicken thighs and brushed to e top crust with butter. Never used canned potatoes before. I gently cubed them before adding to mixture.
This is one of the best pot pies I've ever made! Delicious.

This is a hit to anyone that tries it. My only differences from the recipe...I get a deep dish premade pie crust. I top it with puff pastry fillo dough. I use 2 full chicken breasts which is slightly more than 2 cups. Amazing recipe!

I have made this so many times and my family absolutely loves it. I make it exactly the way it is except I use onion powder instead of onions. My picky kids even gobble it up. It's so easy and delicious!

I made my very first homemade pot pie tonight from this recipe! It was so easy! I added a second can of peas & carrots. So therefore a bit more salt & pepper. The family loved it! Very creamy filling & so delicious.
Made it according to the recipe and my family loved it!!
Great quick recipe. I used cut, fresh red potatoes for a twist
This was delicious!
Loved it great recipe!
Simple easy to follow directions. Family loved it. Have it printed out and plant on making it again
I made two of them so it took longer than expected. I haven't tried them yet, one is a gift. They look delicious. I always decorate my pies.
This is a great starter recipe. You can be as creative as you like with the veggie additions. The ‚Äúgravy‚Äù for this recipe turned out perfect.
I made this last night, it was great. Looking at making it again but getting small freezer bowl to freeze for later meals.
Such a easy to follow recipe & so very delicious!
Fantastic flavor with a little chicken broth. Great consistency. Disappeared that night! People kept sneaking in and having more.
easy. fun and I had extra.
Great recipe, my whole family loved it!!

A very simple yet delicious dish. One of the best-tasting fillings I‚Äôve had. The first time I made this dish, my family loved it so much I made another the next day! It went just as fast as the first pie.
I made this recipe and followed the directions to a T. When I cut into it, it was runny. Also it made too much filling for the piecrust to hold.
I made it with a little variation...I didn‚Äôt have peas and don‚Äôt use canned. I did frozen carrots and frozen green beans, cooked them
This recipe is amazing. Thanks for sharing. Since I had some extra time, I seasoned and baked my chicken. The juices from the baked chicken were used as my broth. Oh boy was this delicious.

I searched for pot pie recipes that included potatoes and found this one. OMG. It is better than any upscale brand on the market. I used precooked turkey in mine and used mixed frozen vegetables. Will definitely make this again. (My computer acted upon so I am not sure if this review was recorded)
Best pot pie ever my dad is pretty picky about his chicken Popeyes and I made this for him and now we only make this one?
I made this last night and it turned out very good. In the future I will add some other spices as it was a little bland.
It was so easy and really good! I liked it just the way it's written up and I plan to make it again soon. I had to use Marjoram as I didn't have other spices and also used celery salt!

So easy to make and came out delicious! I don‚Äôt have a deep pie dish but used a regular one and it was fine. I also used fresh carrots, potatoes and frozen peas because that‚Äôs what I had and it was fine. I will definitely be making this again and again! So good!
Great recipe
As I have tried many recipes for Chicken Pot Pie, and none, obviously to my liking, I was more than a little skeptical to try yet another one.
This was awesome! I've never made this before and it really came out fantastic!

Made this two weeks ago following the recipe exactly. IT. WAS. PERFECT! Until there wasn't any left. I made it again tonight headed on travel reviews from the family. Except I doubled the recipe because it was that good the first time around.

This is simply the best make at home chicken pot pie recipe ever! (I'm very partial to John Harvard's Brewery's chicken pot pie. Though that's no longer available to me in the DC area.) My family is in love with this! Thank you!

It was very good but not enough seasoning so I added about one teaspoon of thyme and parsley. Next time I make it I will add more of these. I also plan to make more of the base/juice. My husband really liked it.
I followed the instructions as it was, brushed egg on the pastry. The pie was a big hit, will be definitely make it again.

Love this recipe‚Äîsuper easy and you should have most ingredients in the house. It‚Äôs a family favorite! (Tip: when making chicken breasts, I often make extra, cut them up and freeze. You‚Äôve got an easy meal a week or two later!!)
Super yummy!
Just made this and half is already gone! My husband loves it! Came out perfect!
Mmm Mmm Good! You can boil and shred/or chop the chicken, and it seems to blend better.

I made this with a few modifications suggested in other reviews. I added sliced celery and saut√©ed it along w/ the onion. I also substituted the broth w/ a can of cream of chicken soup and a can of milk and a teaspoon of garlic herb seasoning. It was creamy & flavorful. My family LOVED it and asked me to make sure to save it so we could make it again. I would add a little more liquid either milk or broth to keep it from getting too thick. Definitely recommend.

I made this with a few modifications suggested in other reviews. I added sliced celery and saut√©ed it along w/ the onion. I also substituted the broth w/ a can of cream of chicken soup and a can of milk and a teaspoon of garlic herb seasoning. It was creamy & flavorful. My family LOVED it and asked me to make sure to save it so we could make it again. I would add a little more liquid either milk or broth to keep it from getting too thick. Definitely recommend.
Very easy to make. Has become a family favorite!
Outstanding
Made this for dinner tonight! Declared just like momma made. Used frozen mixed vegetables and hash brown potatoes in place of the canned. Just nuked them briefly to defrost them a bit.
I boiled a couple of small potatoes and used frozen veggies.
So good! I sauted the onions and added three chopped cloves of garlic prior to adding the flour. My kids and husband loved it. Will make again for sure!
This best recipe! The skillet makes it so much better. I doubled the chicken and added mushrooms.
This recipe is delicious as is!!! I didnt make any changes! Ive made this recipe 4 times and my son and best friend loves it!!
